attributes.action: restore Parliamentary Sovereignity and remove supremacy of the Speaker
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is an unwritten convention that the Speaker of the House of Commons may not be questioned or criticised, the consequences would be that the respective MP would not be able to speak on behalf of their constituents and their political career would be over.

This goes completely against the idea that Parliament has sovereignty over the Executive and the Judiciary - and the convention that the Speaker is supreme over Parliament and cannot be questioned etc and decides who will speak and so forth is completely unlawful and unconstitutional and should now be immediately subject to Judicial Review. 

The role of the Speaker should be that of chairing sessions and scheduling time for MP's to speak - and MP's should tell the Speaker what they will speak about as requested by their constituents.

If the supremacy of Parliament is not restored over the Speaker - then we encourage the Speaker to be subject to Judicial Review, whereby the Speaker does not represent or act on behalf of Parliament and is not therefore exempt from due process.

We must have Parliamentary Sovereignty to make sure the voice of the people is adequately represented and so that Britain remains a democracy.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
